Lakehead university admission is ongoing for all Ontario interested student who wants to apply

 

Lakehead University Admission Requirements for Ontario Students

The General Admission Requirements for Ontario students

Firstly to be considered for admittance as an Ontario High School student, you must be presently attending a high school in Ontario on a full-time basis or have freshly graduated, and have not finished any post-secondary studies at another institute.

To meet the General Admission Requirements to Lakehead, you will need the following:

  • achievement of the Ontario Secondary School Diploma (OSSD);
  • have at least a minimum  average of 6 Grade 12U or M courses, or related, including program-specific requirement courses;
  • The least amount of  70%* in general last average

Upper averages may be essential for admittance into programs in which the demand for places by skilled applicants exceeds the supply of obtainable spaces.
Admission averages are calculated using the top 6 Grade 12 U or M courses.

In addition to the General Admission necessities, please also review the Program exact Pre-requisites to verify what particular courses you will necessitate from your high school background.

Steps on how to apply to Lakehead University

If you are taking courses throughout the day at an Ontario Secondary School (this includes students recurring for the second semester and graduated students returning to advance one or more courses)

Visit the101 Application Form
click here 105 Application Form

Note that: Lakehead University will consider applicants for provisional admission upon successful completion of the General Admission Requirements. Applicants are expected to apply when the admission application is open.

Required Documentation

You are to submit the following required documents as part of the application process:

  • Your Official Transcripts will be required:
    In most cases, your grades will be forwarded to Lakehead from your high school through OUAC. If you are taking courses during summer school, you will be arranging for the last official grades to be sent to Enrolment Services.
    For All Other Secondary School Graduates: Submit your official high school transcripts directly from the issuing institution to Enrolment Services – Undergraduate Admissions at Lakehead University.
  • Language Proficiency Requirements (if applicable):
Important Deadline to notes

 

Deadline to Accept Offer Using OUAC Account, and Receive verification Deposit fee

 June 1, 2024
Release Date of Final Offers July 2024 (Final Round based on all Grade 12 Final Grades)
time limit to Submit last Official Transcript from Summer School August 13, 2024
limit to Meet Admission Conditions August 13, 2024
